## PrintUtilities.wrapWordsToLines() method

Applies word wrapping and returns an array of lines.

**Signature:**

```typescript
static wrapWordsToLines(text: string, maxLineLength?: number, indentOrLinePrefix?: number | string): string[];
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

text


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

The text to wrap


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

maxLineLength


</td><td>

number


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The maximum length of a line, defaults to the console width


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

indentOrLinePrefix


</td><td>

number \| string


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The number of spaces to indent the wrapped lines or the string to prefix each line with, defaults to no prefix


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

string\[\]
